result.execSummary:
The defendant Roland Garza Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Roland Garza Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Roland Garza Jr. was found guilty of 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Psychiatric/psychological.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not have contact with Carl N family w/out consent, Leah A, known felons or drug dealers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody - writ from Dodge Correctional) with Atty Timothy Kay.  Clerk K. Zirbel. Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Bielski.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from:  Julie N., Brandon B., Kathy D.  Court imposes a total sentence of 25 years WSP; 20 years initial confinement w/credit for 161 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for SIP/SAP; pay $250 DNA surcharge.

With Elizabeth/DDA Graveley and Atty Bielski, and by approval of the court, the SEH of 8/6/15 at 3:30pm is rescheduled, as Atty Bielski just received the PSI and hasn't had time to review it w/deft; reset to 8/12/15 at 3pm.

Atty Bielski acknowledges receipt.  On State's motion, cts 2 thru 7 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 8/6/15 at 3:30pm.  Bond continued.
